playn.core
Interface Image

All Known Subinterfaces:
AsyncImage<I>, CanvasImage, Image.Region
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractImage, ImageGL, ImageRegionGL
public interface Image

An image.

Method Detail

width

float width()
This image's width in pixels.

height

float height()
This image's height in pixels.

isReady

boolean isReady()
Whether or not this image is ready to be used.

addCallback

void addCallback(Callback<? super Image> callback)
Adds a callback to be notified when this image has loaded. If the image is already loaded, the callback will be notified immediately; otherwise on the main playn thread at a later time. The callback is discarded once the image is loaded.

subImage

Image.Region subImage(float x,
                      float y,
                      float width,
                      float height)
Returns an image that draws the specified sub-region of this image.

Parameters:
x - the x offset (in pixels) of the subimage.
y - the y offset (in pixels) of the subimage.
width - the width (in pixels) of the subimage.
height - the height (in pixels) of the subimage.

toPattern

Pattern toPattern()
Creates a Pattern that can be used to use this image as a fill in a canvas.

getRgb

void getRgb(int startX,
            int startY,
            int width,
            int height,
            int[] rgbArray,
            int offset,
            int scanSize)
Extracts pixel data from a rectangular area of this image. This method may perform poorly, in particular on HTML and Flash platforms - avoid using this if possible. The returned pixel format is (alpha << 24 | red << 16 | green << 8 | blue), where alpha, red, green and blue are the corresponding channel values, ranging from 0 to 255 inclusive. Currently not implemented for iOS.

Parameters:
startX - x-coordinate of the upper left corner of the area.
startY - y-coordinate of the upper left corner of the area.
width - width of the area.
height - height of the area.
rgbArray - will be filled with the pixel data from the area
offset - fill start offset in rgbArray.
scanSize - number of pixels in a row in rgbArray.

transform

Image transform(Image.BitmapTransformer xform)
Generates a new image from this image's bitmap, using a bitmap transformer created for the platform in use. See JavaBitmapTransformer and IOSBitmapTransformer. This does not work on sub-images.

ensureTexture

int ensureTexture(boolean repeatX,
                  boolean repeatY)
Creates a texture for this image (if one does not already exist) and returns its OpenGL texture id. Returns 0 if the underlying image data is not yet ready or if this platform does not use OpenGL. If either repeatX or repeatY are true, the underlying image data will be scaled up into a power of two texture. The image will maintain one or both of an unscaled and scaled texture until a call to clearTexture() is made or until this image is garbage collected (at which time the textures are cleared).

Parameters:
repeatX - controls S texture wrapping parameter (repeat or clamp to edge).
repeatY - controls T texture wrapping parameter (repeat or clamp to edge).

clearTexture

void clearTexture()
Clears the GPU texture(s) associated with this image, on platforms implemented via OpenGL. Does nothing on non-OpenGL platforms. In general it is not necessary to call this method. Images added to ImageLayer instances automatically clear their texture when the image layer is removed from the scene graph. Textures are also cleared when the image is garbage collected. However, if you manually call ensureTexture(boolean, boolean), or if you draw images to a Surface, you may wish to clear textures manually to avoid running out of GPU memory before garbage collection has a chance to run and clear the textures for you.

glTexImage2D

void glTexImage2D(GL20 gl,
                  int target,
                  int level,
                  int internalformat,
                  int format,
                  int type)
See http://www.khronos.org/opengles/sdk/docs/man/xhtml/glTexImage2D.xml The default implementation is based on getRgb and will hand over a RGBA byte array -- please set the (internal)format and type parameters accordingly -- they are mainly present for future support of different formats. The WebGL implementation will pass through all parameters.

glTexSubImage2D

void glTexSubImage2D(GL20 gl,
                     int target,
                     int level,
                     int xOffset,
                     int yOffset,
                     int format,
                     int type)
See http://www.khronos.org/opengles/sdk/docs/man/xhtml/glTexSubImage2D.xml The default implementation is based on getRgb and will hand over a RGBA byte array -- please set the (internal)format and type parameters accordingly -- they are mainly present for future support of different formats. The WebGL implementation will pass through all parameters.
